item.title: 8 reminder again, 18th July
item.description:

item.title: Flytip (?), 18th July
item.description:
There are multiple bin liners full of rubbish that have been left by the main waste containers at this location. I realise this could be 'overflow' from the containers but they don't seem to be getting removed and are building up. Naturally the foxes are getting into them causing more litter around the area (which Sainsbury's isn't cleaning up despite numerous reports over time).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue, 18th July
item.description:
I have noticed that you have been cutting back a lot of the shrubs along this section of the Croydon Rd Recreation Grounds (along the metal fence). Unfortunately this has revealed lots of litter, with much more building up on a regular basis. I really think there should be more focus along this metal fence area, by Croydon Road, as the litter issue can be pretty unsightly, especially within the grounds.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping still present, 18th July
item.description:
I reported fly tipping yesterday (ticket 7890530). The council marked this as resolved but as you can see this is NOT resolved. Photo as of this evening (8.46pm).
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven tarmac outside 21 Samos Road, 18th July
item.description:
The pavement outside 21 Samos Road is increasingly uneven. The tree on the road causing it is huge, and the roots are doing a lot of damage now. I am worried some parts of the pavement and kerb area are a trip hazard and causing a problem for elderly, wheelchair users, buggies etc.can it be dug up, flattened, and relaid as patch repairs have not worked over the years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Samos Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two flytipped mattresses, 18th July
item.description:
Have reported this’s three times. Veolia need to act immediately….

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 173-175, Cleveland Street, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Yesterday afternoon, I reported to you about :"Extreme wet dog fouling besides a tree which is in front of 87 Fernhead Road". So far nothing has been done!, 18th July
item.description:
Yesterday afternoon, I reported to you about :"Extreme wet dog besides a tree which is in front of 87 Fernhead Road". So far nothing has been done yet! I have seen people cross the road besides this tree and children play near this tree. Please could this be cleaned up ASAP. Thank you in anticipation. Yesterday's reference number was 7895353.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another bike dumped, 18th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Finsbury Park, London

item.title: Waste bins from The Clock House pub blocking entrance from our building, 18th July
item.description:
There are 3 big waste bins from pub on Barry road. These bins are blocking the entrance from our Kings Court building. Also this is a bother to people as these are taking large part of the public path/pavement. Flies are all over them. The pub should have their waste bins inside the premises.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196a, Peckham Rye, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken water pipe?!, 18th July
item.description:
Noticed spillage of water, but since there has not been any rain very recently it actually is water coming from under the asphalt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Catherine Grove, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number 86 being hostile and threatening when taking their “promised” parking space., 18th July
item.description:
It’s been absolutely ridiculous. Parking on clive road has been for the last couple months. Even coming home at off peak times having to park 2 streets away.. it’s a nightmare. Then we have number 86, who regularly put their bins outside their house to reserve their parking space as if they own the road. Insane. What’s even more crazy is that they get hostile and angry when you move to bins or try to reason with them. Police won’t do anything and the council too. Something needs to be done. They aren’t VIPs this road is for all of us.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
